intro: Anil schultziana, commonly known as the Schultze's anil, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue or violet flowers that bloom in summer. The plant has narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces capsule fruits containing numerous small seeds. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and by plant enthusiasts.
